conclusion: Understanding what happens when objects A and B move through the air to the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects A and B are the ones moving.
Objects C, D, E, and F are the ones currently on the table.
Objects A and B are moved through the air to the locations where C, D, E, and F are.
Due to gravity, objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
When A and B are placed down on top of C, D, E, and F, the objects will likely stack or cover them.
Objects A and B will cover objects C, D, E, and F, as shown in the step-by-step illustrations.
The illustrations confirm that objects A and B settle over objects C, D, E, and F.
The final image depicts A and B draped over the table, covering the original objects.
When objects A and B are placed down on the locations of objects C, D, E, and F, they cover these objects, as shown in the final image.
